strings.string: \rThe limestone cliff looms overhead.\r
\rThe canyon walls produce strange echoes as the water bubbles down the creek.\r
\rA redtailed hawk passes high over you.\r
\rBushes cling to the box canyon walls.\r
\rThe cliff face is dotted with seashells and wormtracks.\r
\rYou can't pass the cliff face.\r
\rThe cave wall is slick with moisture.\r
\rThe cave walls are damp.\r
\rThe creek rushes in under the high cliffs.\r
\rYou are in the desert north of the settlement of Highpool.\r
\rYou are kneedeep in Highpool Creek. The water is cool but the rocks are slippery.\r
\rLeaving Highpool.\r
\rYou slip and fall into the water with a splash. Your face burns with embarrassment. You hear children's laughter.\r
\rYou easily cross on large stepping stones.\r
Jeering from hiding, mutant kids hold slingshots in their hands.\r
\rOddly, you see no bodies, no blood. Neither do you see any children anywhere.\r
\rYou hear a giggle behind a shrub. Then softly, "Nyah, nyah, ya missed me, nyah!"\r
\rThis is a playground with swings and slides. Bushes are all around.\r
\rBushes rustle and a childish voice asks, "Whatsa matter? Can't shoot straight, Ranger?"\r
\rA child's shadow flits under the swingset. "Ha-ha, ya missed me!" the kid chortles.\r
The mutated munchkins howl with laughter.\r
\rAgain you find neither blood nor bodies.\r
\rA kid yells, "My gramma shoots better than you!"\r
\rYou exit the cave.\r
\rEntering the infirmary.\r
A chubby kid in a hat stands up pouting, "You guys ought to pick on somebody your own size!"\r
\rA child lies dead at your feet near his Red Ryder hat. A puppy crawls up whining and lays its head on the boy's chest.\r
\rA hot wind blows, summoning clouds of dust. You shiver as if with cold.\r
\rThe dust settles, revealing a transformed valley which you hardly recognize.\r
\rAppearing slowly from the swirling dust is... the famous Red Ryder himself! He looks sad and angry.\r
Red Ryder raises his Red Ryder Range Model Air Rifle (with compass in the stock) and fires!\r
\rA tumbleweed bounces past you. You hear the distant laughter of children.\r
\rDid you think you could kill Red Ryder? No way, bud!\r
\rHighpool Creek burbles past. It looks about two feet deep.\r
\rA tearful boy watches you from the nearby brush.\r
Do you want to talk?\r\r\x11\x10Yes\r\x10No\r
Y
N
\rEntering the shop.\r
\rThe young boy sobs out "Rex!", then runs away.\r
BOBBY'S DOG
What do you want to ask him about?\r
REX
DOG
JACKIE
CAVE
BUSH
\r"Don't kill my dog Rex, okay? Please?!"\r
\r"I told Jackie to keep clear of the cave!"\r
\r"The cave is over behind the bushes but we aren't supposed to go there."\r
\rThe kid fidgets and then shrugs, "I dunno."\r
\r"Honest, Rex didn't mean to get sick. I just hid him till he got better."\r
BUSHES
\r"I hid Rex in the cave where 'he can get better. Don't hurt him, okay?"\r
\r"Jackie went into the cave yesterday. I haven't seen her since."\r
\r"The cave is between the pool and the west cliff wall, kinda between those two trees."\r
\rYou find a deep hole to a dark cave. A short strand of frayed rope, about 3 inches long, dangles from a tree limb.\r
\rYou tie your rope to the tree limb and climb down into the darkness.\r
\rEven here the cave is very dark. The floor is rocky.\r
\rYou see a snapped rope, the way the children got in and out.\r
You hear a growl like metal ripping. A huge dog lunges from a dark corner, jaws foaming.\r
\rOn a pile of fresh earth is a wood plank with words, "My dog Rex, gunned down by vigilante Rangers."\r
A youth you recognize stands up. "You killed my dog, you dirty Rangers!"\r
\rRocks and boulders make it difficult to pass.\r
\rYou wriggle past.\r
You fall and slip back with skinned knees.\r
\rRocks and boulders make it very hard to pass here.\r
\rThe roof fell here once. You can barely move about. You note a broken human bone.\r
\rWhat luck! Bad luck for the dude who died here but your good luck to find his stuff.\r
\rThis is a wall.\r
\rThe rocks are slick and mossy. Do not swim here.\r
\rThe youngsters who live here are supposed to keep the doors locked, but they forget.\r
\rThis is a dorm for young children. There is nothing here to interest a Ranger.\r
\rThis is a dorm for teens. Nothing much of interest here.\r
\rYou check the small shelf behind the desk. \r
\rThe fields near you are watered by a canal that gets its water from the creek.\r
\rSouth of you are two-story adobe buildings that resemble dorms.\r
\rThe door resists your efforts.\r
\rA note tacked to the wall says:\r-- cave\r-- adults: raid outlaws\r-- Jackie\r-- Bobby's dog?\r-- fix water purifier\r
\rThe entry is cool. A store counter is nearby and the room beyond looks like a gaming hall.\r
\rA name is painted on the door, "Mr. Jumbo." The door is locked.\r
\rThe door is open.\r
\rA poker player says, "He's out but you can use the key beside the door."\r
\r"Hey, whaddya think you're doing to the door!" yell the angry juvies.\r
The youths are enraged by your un-guest-like actions.\r
\rYou see a bed to the west and a cluttered desk to the east.\r
\rOn the wall are faded photos of kids. T-shirts say "Camp Highpool."\r
\rA dry bed where once was water, now only an occasional beetle runs past.\r
\rA hot wind blows across empty desert sand.\r
\rA dilapidated building. Sunlight streams through the roof beams.\r
\rThis bedroom looks like a scumpit.\r
\rYour curiosity is rewarded!\r
\rIn the bottom dresser drawer is a piece of jewelry and some cash.\r
\rUnder a loose board beneath the bed you find quite a cache!\r
\rThis is a cluttered desk.\r
\rYou see nothing special.\r
\rThis looks like a workshop. Old machinery is nearby, and there's a cot in the back.\r
\rOld machine parts lie on the floor, surrounded by a scatter of tools.\r
\rThis big contraption is a patchwork machine. You recognize a pump. Lime-crusted pipes go under the floor.\r
\rYou deduce that this is a water purification device. It looks broken.\r
\rThe gaping hole beside the pumps leads you to think it could be fixed with a new engine.\r
\rThe engine slides into place and you start the device running!\r
\rThe sound of the engine starting up brings a pack of youngsters to the doorway.\r
\r"Thank you very much for fixing the water purifier!" They cheer loudly, praising you all.\r
\rThe cheers quiet. "We'd give you more but you seem to have already rewarded yourself. Please accept this token reward."\r
\r"We wanted to fix it for a long time! Please accept our deep and sincere thanks!"\r
\rThis contraption is a patchwork water purifier with a new engine that is running merrily.\r
\rA dry lake bed descends into the limestone.\r
\rYou see several handwritten notes on the desk.\r
\rOne note is cash accounts with the Rail Nomads. Another outlines sneak-attack plans against desert marauders.\r
\rThis last note seems odd since it clearly assumes only two attackers against many.\r
\rOne note is a reminder to put a trapdoor over the cave across the creek. Another is about hydrophobia.\r
\x07Welcome to the shop.\r
\x07Welcome to the infirmary.\r
Your rope is tied to the tree. Want to slide down into the cave?\r\r\x11\x10Yes\r\x10No\r
"Please help me get out of here."\r
\r"Thank you for rescuing me."\r
